Good message, but it seems an overrated book. I love other books of Nguyen Phong, but this book is quite boring.

The first part of the book seems a little fictional and childish for me lol, and many details seem to be left blank at the end. Like Kris said, Thomas would have met Kor again to pay for his crime, but no information after all.

It is like a fiction but without a good plot.

True to its name, this book is truly â€œPsychology in a blink of an eyeâ€. The information is super brief and not to mention, Iâ€™ve already known 99% of them before. The book only stopped at giving us information, thereâ€™s no analyzation, no authorâ€™s opinion. Overall, this book was very forgettable with nothing special, a 4 minute psychology video on YouTube is even better than this. By the way, there was a bunch of spellings errors, didnâ€™t you have an editor or something? Such a disappointment.

If anyone is wondering about the content, this book talked about: social norms, stereotypes, the halo effect and some other more social psychology. However, the book only defined those words and give us a short example or experiment. Not much of a different compares to a dictionary...a really short one.

I finished this book in 30 minutes. The only good thing I guess, it has illustrations.

This is a story about the life, poor childhood of each character in the story.
The book consists of 81 short chapters and each chapter is a story about life, about love, friendship, brotherhood ...
Before the first chapter, Nguyen Nhat Anh wrote two verses "Sitting silently in the wind listening to the night
suddenly saw yellow flowers on the green grass "
It was just two sentences but it was enough to make me quickly turn the page to begin into the first pages. With this long story, Nguyen Nhat Anh has told us about moral lessons, humanities and first careless love.
So welcome to you to read and feel a beautiful, sweet and tormented childhood that everyone has experienced in "Yellow flowers on the green grass". (less)

Continuing to be a romantic love story under the delicate pen of Nguyen Nhat Anh.
He not only wrote stories for children but also for adults who were once lacking in children and still had a young soul. Describing a triangle love with the deep sympathy of Vinh, who always dedicates his love to the heroine named Mien.
"An award of love is itself", everyone wants to have a beautiful love and the ending he brings us a profound result: the sacrifice of Vinh was make up for him by loving of Mien.

Well, this is easily his most forgettable book. After the massive success of "I see yellow flower on green grass", who would have thought he would break the market with something like this, a book about dog ??? Thank god I didn't buy this book. Don't get me wrong, writing about dog is still okay as long as it is still original and thought-provoking (like some other works of his). "I am Beto" is 10 times better than this in terms of those criteria. I personally think this book failed me, but number-wise, it is a massive success with over 100.000 copies printed in the first place.
Why i still gave it 4 stars? Based solely on my enjoyment level, there were some seriously funny scenes and I broke out laughing. I don't think those funny moments will last long in my head, but I have a good time, so I don't want to be so harsh with the rating (less)

Nguyen Nhat Anh is that man, that genius, the icon of my our country's literature. Every new book of him always outsold the previous ones, so I always feel the hype and the urge to read whenever a new work of him is published. I bought this book 6 months after the publishment, and only till now (over a year after the publishment) did I read it. Stringed from the story of 4 innocent friends at the age of eight with all kinds of mischief: Mui, Hai, Tun and Ti. Through each chapter, we see the author through the character of Mui to think about the world of children and the adult world with all the obsessions such as time, money, love, marriage, family, death. . And thanks to adults, children are always protected and loved to have childhood memories filled with pure laughter.

This is a story innocent student age, full of laughter and no shortage of jokes, playful.
With a clear writing style, when he wrote about the student, it makes many readers from kid to adult have been fascinated and excited when they read books of Nguyen Nhat Anh. The book has 21 short chapters and each chapter is a story about class, friends, about "mischievous boy" Quynh with strange ears that makes me gobble up those short stories and sympathize with him when he gets people who joke and bully but can only fight silently. Reading about his quiet love for Nga (who always defended him when he was bullied) I became more interested in reading.
Nguyen Nhat Anh has shown us a beautiful friendship, although that friendship does not become a bright love, but what they have given for each other which is actually far more precious. So guys, welcome to you to read and feel a friendship, a touching story in "he Mischievous Boy". (less)

The book really gives the reader a happy atmosphere, filled with laughter.

The book is about Teo, who was unlucky in a terrible accident caused a spinal injury and after surgery he suffered from a sequelae that had to lie in one place. The story revolves around children who are innocent, playful and always a strong spiritual support for Teo, do everything for him, teach him,... Through this story, I see whether Teo must lie in a position spot, unable to run and play but he still showed us optimism, feeling himself lucky in an unlucky situation. Like many other books of Nguyen Nhat Anh, he always wrote for children but the words, lessons, messages send to everyone. When I reading the book "Making friends with the sky" make me feel the love, covering Teo of the relatives around him and he was also his brainchild when the author spent 7, 8 months to write this work. So please don't hesitate to find and read "Make friends with the sky" to have deep feelings! (less)
